title: Strictly's Neil Jones out of live show after injury
text:
Both Will and Neil are out of the show due to injury

Strictly professional Neil Jones has been forced to pull out of Saturday’s Strictly Come Dancing leaving his partner Alex Scott paired with Kevin Clifton.

The Strictly Twitter account confirmed the news, as Claudia Winkleman also revealed live on air that Strictly hopeful Will Bayley had also injured himself in rehearsals and had pulled out under medical advice.

She then added: ‘You may have also noticed Neil is missing this evening. Now unfortunately he also suffered an injury earlier today and is unable to dance tonight.

‘But the brilliant Kevin will be stepping in to perform with Alex later in the show.’

‘I’m gutted tonight I won’t be able to dance because I was injured earlier today but I know @AlexScott will smash it tonight,’ shared Neil.

‘She’s worked hard all week and she’s in safe hands with @keviclifton #strictly #teamred’.

BBC said in a statement: ‘Sadly, Will Bayley was injured during training and medics have said he cannot dance in the show this weekend.

‘Under the rules of Strictly Come Dancing, Will has been granted a bye to next week.

‘Separately, Alex Scott’s partner Neil Jones received an injury whilst training this morning. Kevin Clifton has stepped in to partner Alex in tonight’s show.’

Both Will and Alex have been middle of the leaderboard but have been improving week by week, and last week Alex was near the top after stunning the judges with her Charleston to Pump Up the Jam.

The pair, who scored a whopping 33 points for their Charleston, have also been romantically linked after both Neil and Alex recently ended long term relationships prior to the show beginning.

Alex later revealed they were performing couple’s choice – and Kevin revealed he only had a couple hours notice for the performance.

What a champ!

‘He joked: ‘Well, I’ve got to get in the final one way or another, haven’t I? But this is not me, this is about Alex and she is so amazing.

‘She’s been guiding me through the routine and that’s real test for her so I will do my best for you and for Neil.’

What a champ!

Will, a 31-year-old table tennis player who won gold at the Rio 2016 Paralympics, was born with arthrogryposis – a condition which causes curved joints affecting all four of his limbs.

He had been paired with Janette Manrara and the week prior had dedicated his routine to those in Great Ormond Street Hospital, and then had the judges (and viewers at home) sobbing as he glided across the ballroom with his partner Janette to the track 7 Years by Lukas Graham.

‘Hi everyone, I am absolutely gutted I cannot be performing tonight on strictly with Janette, sadly I’m injured and not fit to dance,’ he later shared.

‘I hope to be back on the dance floor next week.

‘Good luck to everyone tonight. Thanks for all your messages guys, ill be back!!’

Strictly Come Dancing continues Sunday night on BBC One.
